newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Jakarta stocks end higher on late buying.
newsitem.headline: Jakarta stocks end higher on late buying.

text.p: Jakarta stocks ended higher on Friday on late buying across the board, boosted by improved sentiment in property and banking issues, brokers said.

"The index started to move up after being flat for almost two week, helped by sustained buying in property and banking stocks," Harumi Cempaka, analyst with Asian Development Securities, said. She expected a series of initial public offerings in the coming week would give a further boost to the market and maintain the upward trend.
The Jakarta Composite Index closed 3.4 points, or 0.49 percent, higher at 698.62 points.
Total turn-over was estimated at 500 billion rupiah, with the combined finance and property sectors contributing about 20 percent to the total.
The manufacturing sector, which contains the largest number of issues, also contributed about 100 billion rupiah to the turnover.
The index rose 3.6 points on the week.
Brokers said encouraging first quarter results of some property stocks such as PT Kawasan Industri Jababeka and Ciputra Development had helped improve sentiment.
Jababeka said on Friday it posted net profit of 67 billion rupiah in the 1997 first quarter against 23 billion rupiah in the same 1996 period.
"Developers such as Ciputra have shown very promising growth in terms of sales and net income. There is no reason to put off buying it," one analyst said.
Improved sentiment in banking stocks was due to higher earnings prospects of the industry, brokers and analysts said.

"Reports that the government is studying the possibility of mergers among state-owned banks has also given a positive sign to the financial industry," Lin Che Wei, research director of Socgen Cosby, said.
Wei also said the declining trend in deposit rates combined with relatively stable lending rates had lifted sentiment on banking stocks as they could maintain higher profit margins.
